name: surgeon
content:
surgeon

noun
 
 
/ˈsɜːdʒən/
 
/ˈsɜːrdʒən/
jump to other results
  1. ​a doctor who is trained to perform surgery (= medical operations that involve cutting open a person’s body)
    • a brain/heart surgeon
    • Surgeons performed two operations on him yesterday.
    compare physician
    Wordfinder
    • cure
    • doctor
    • examine
    • medicine
    • patient
    • practice
    • prescribe
    • receptionist
    • specialist
    • surgeon
    see also dental surgeon, oral surgeon, plastic surgeon, tree surgeon, veterinary surgeon
    Extra Examples
    • He is determined to qualify as a surgeon.
    • Many people are terrified at the thought of the surgeon's knife.
    • Surgeons removed her right leg above the knee.
    • the surgeon who will operate on you
    Topics Healthcareb2, Jobsb2
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryadjective
    • distinguished
    • eminent
    • leading
    • …
    verb + surgeon
    • be
    • work as
    • become
    • …
    surgeon + verb
    • operate
    • perform something
    • insert something
    • …
    phrases
    • the surgeon’s knife
    See full entry
    Word OriginMiddle English: from Anglo-Norman French surgien, contraction of Old French serurgien, based on Latin chirurgia, from Greek kheirourgia ‘handiwork, surgery’, from kheir ‘hand’ + ergon ‘work’.
See surgeon in the Oxford Advanced American DictionarySee surgeon in the Oxford Learner's Dictionary of Academic English

name: oral surgeon
content:
oral surgeon

noun
 
/ˌɔːrəl ˈsɜːdʒən/
 
/ˌɔːrəl ˈsɜːrdʒən/
(North American English)
(also dental surgeon)
(British and North American English)
jump to other results
  1. ​a dentist who performs surgery inside the mouth
    • She started her practice as an oral surgeon in 2010.
See oral surgeon in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: oral surgeon

name: tree surgeon
content:
tree surgeon

noun
 
/ˈtriː sɜːdʒən/
 
/ˈtriː sɜːrdʒən/
(also formal arborist)
jump to other results
  1. ​a person whose job is treating trees that are damaged or have a disease, especially by cutting off branches, to try to preserve them
See tree surgeon in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: tree surgeon

noun
 
/ˈdentl sɜːdʒən/
 
/ˈdentl sɜːrdʒən/
 (formal)
jump to other results
  1. ​a dentist, especially one who performs surgery inside the mouth compare oral surgeonTopics Healthcarec1, Jobsc1

name: Surgeon General
content:
Surgeon General

noun
 
/ˌsɜːdʒən ˈdʒenrəl/
 
/ˌsɜːrdʒən ˈdʒenrəl/
(plural Surgeons General)
jump to other results
  1. ​(in the US) the head of a public health service or of a medical service in the armed forces
    • Surgeon General’s warning: cigarette smoking causes cancer
See Surgeon General in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: Surgeon General

/ˈvetnri sɜːdʒən/,

name: dentist
content:
dentist

noun
 
 
/ˈdentɪst/
 
/ˈdentɪst/
jump to other results
  1. ​
     
    (also formal dental surgeon)
    a person whose job is to take care of people’s teeth
    • to see/visit/consult your dentist
    • the dentist's chair/drill
    Wordfinder

    • cavity
    • check-up
    • crown
    • dentist

    • filling

    See full entry
  2. ​
     
    often dentist’s
    (plural dentists)
    a place where a dentist sees patients
    • I hate going to the dentist.
    • an appointment at the dentist’s
    • She couldn’t get treatment because she wasn’t registered with the dentist.
